title: Daniel Farke consigned to Norwich departures as Tottenham target Max Aarons
text:
Daniel Farke has left the door open for Norwich's England Under-21 international Max Aarons to join Tottenham in January.

Spurs manager Mauricio Pochettino has made the acquisition of a new right-back a priority following the summer departure of Kieran Trippier to Atletico Madrid in the summer.

Serge Aurier and Kyle Walker-Peters, the current options in that position, have failed to impress so far and talks over a deal for Aarons, 19, have already begun.

Norwich manager Farke made it clear that his club did not need to sell, but would not stand in the way of a player leaving for a bigger stage for the right price.

"Sometimes a player develops quicker than a club and you have to accept it if a player wants to have a bigger move and that there are bigger clubs in world football than we are," he said.
description: Daniel Farke has left the door open for Norwich's England Under-21 international Max Aarons to join Tottenham in January.
